info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 02 at 4:20PM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Litchfield, east central Ulster, northern Dutchess and south central Columbia Counties through 500 PM EDT... At 419 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Rhinebeck, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Kingston, Rhinebeck, Amenia, Sharon, Pine Plains, Red Hook, Canaan, Millerton, Stanfordville, Port Ewen, Falls Village, Staatsburg, Cornwall Bridge, Esopus, Bethel, Salisbury, Milan, Smithfield, Ancramdale and Norrie Heights. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized poor drainage flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM EDT for northern Connecticut...and east central New York.
